content: Many were confused when the Warriors ownership group recently acquired VR Tango, a small Norwegian company specializing in disposable, virtual-reality-controllable sex toys for extremely tall individuals. Less publicized, but just as strange, was the team’s purchase of a medical-feeding-tube company and the hiring of a Japanese architectural firm closely associated with the construction of pod hotels and office spaces. But it was all part of a plan, the next step in Lacob’s stated goal to keep the Warriors light-years ahead of the competition by turning inefficiencies into strengths.
